Finally finished. I gonna seed, for a while, now.
Considerations: The quality is good, both video, and audio.
But in my humble opinion, could be better if:

Had 5.1 audio channels;
1920x1080 video;
subtitles included in the package in a separate files (maybe keep the other audios, in other languages, too;
save in mkv, which keeps the legends already in the film.

I think a bit more quality sound and video, compensate an increased final file size.
But is a good job, anyway.

Please continue uploading your 3D videos, even if is slow to downloading them.

Use MKV2AC3 to convert DTS audio to AC3.
It takes less than 20 minutes (without any change in the video, only audio is converted) to convert and preserve all original chanells and play perfectly in TVs LG. On my LG LW5700 42 "works perfectly. :)

MKV2AC3 is freeware:

http://www.softpedia.com/get/Multimedia/Video/Encoders-Converter-DIVX-Related/MKV2AC3.shtml

Handbrake converts audio as well, but is much slower because the video is recoded as well.
